identificationModule.briefTitle: Bimanual Motor Skill Learning Through Robotics in Stroke Survivors and Healthy Individuals
identificationModule.officialTitle: Bimanual Motor Skill Learning Through Robotics in Stroke Survivors and Healthy Individuals

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: MD, PhD, Neurologist, Principal Investigator, Clinical Professor

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To test the capacity of healthy and chronic stroke patients to learn and retain a complex bimanual motor skill, trained on the neurorehabilitation robot REAplan (R) (bimanual version).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Over 3 consecutive days, healthy individuals and chronic stroke patients (1) will be evaluated and (2) will train on the neurorehabilitation robot REAplan(R).

They will practice several tasks on the robot REAplan (R) (bimanual version), requiring either movements with the affected arm (unimanual tasks) and complex, coordinated movements with both arms (bimanual tasks).

In addition, several "classical" clinical scales and tests will be used to evaluate overall motor-sensory-cognitive functions (clinical tests, questionnaires, ...).

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Evaluation of bimanual motor skill learning Motor skill learning with a rehabilitation robot

armGroups.label: intervention
armGroups.description: Training on the rehabilitation robot REAplan(R) to learn complex, coordinated bimanual movements
interventionNames: Device: Bimanual motor skill learning with the REAplan(R) rehabilitation robot

armGroups.label: control intervention
armGroups.description: Training on the rehabilitation robot REAplan(R) with simple movements
interventionNames: Device: Bimanual motor skill learning with the REAplan(R) rehabilitation robot

interventions.name: Bimanual motor skill learning with the REAplan(R) rehabilitation robot
interventions.description: REAplan(R) rehabilitation robot : training to perform complex, coordinated, bimanual movements

primaryOutcomes.measure: bi-SAT, bimanual Speed/Accurady Trade-off measured by the REAplan robot
primaryOutcomes.description: bimanual Speed/Accurady Trade-off: mathematical computation of the relationship bewteen speed and accuracy
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: change between baseline (Day 1) and after training (Day 3)

primaryOutcomes.measure: bi-CO, bimanual Coordination factor measured by the REAplan robot
primaryOutcomes.description: bimanual Coordination factor, mathematical measure of the phase coherence between speeds of both arms
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: change between baseline (Day 1) and after training (Day 3)

primaryOutcomes.measure: bi-Force, bimanual Coordination factor measured by the REAplan robot
primaryOutcomes.description: bimanual forces, forces exerted in the wrong direction by each arm (Newtons)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: change between baseline (Day 1) and after training (Day 3)

secondaryOutcomes.description: bimanual Speed/Accurady Trade-off: mathematical computation of the relationship
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: change between baseline (Day 1) and after training (Day 3)

secondaryOutcomes.description: bimanual forces, forces exerted in the wrong direction by each arm (Newtons)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: change between baseline (Day 1) and after training (Day 3)

secondaryOutcomes.description: bimanual Coordination factor, mathematical measure of the phase coherence between speeds of both arms
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: change between baseline (Day 1) and after training (Day 3)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Smoothness of movement : Spectral Arc Length (SPARC)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: change between baseline (Day 1) and after training (Day 3)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Error in centimeres or degrees during bimanual reaching
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: change between baseline (Day 1) and after training (Day 3)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Box \& Blocks Test (timed transfert of blocks from one space to the other, 3 trials/hand)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: change between baseline (Day 1) and after training (Day 3)

secondaryOutcomes.description: whole-hand Grip Force (GF) measured with a dynamometer, 3 trials/hand)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: change between baseline (Day 1) and after training (Day 3)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Visual Analog Scale for fatigue (VAS fatigue)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Visual Analog Scale to evaluate fatigue = a psychometric response scale which can be used in questionnaires. It is a measurement instrument for subjective characteristics or attitudes that cannot be directly measured. When responding to a VAS item, respondents specify their level of agreement to a statement by indicating a position along a continuous line between two end-points. Range : 0- 10.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: change between baseline (Day 1) and after training (Day 3)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
STROKE PATIENTS :

Inclusion Criteria:

* having a chronic stroke (\>6 months)
* aged 18-90 years
* with demonstrate a stroke lesion on brain imaging.

Exclusion Criteria:

* difficulty in understanding or executing commands
* drug/alcohol abuse
* severe aphasia / cognitive deficits interfering with study
* inability to voluntarily move the affected arm (i.e. complete paralysis of the arm)
* multiple strokes / dementia / psychiatric condition
* botulinum toxin injections (to be evaluated)

HEALTHY INDIVIDUALS :

Inclusion Criteria:

- 18-90 years

Exclusion Criteria:

* neurological conditions interfering with the study
* drug/alcohol abuse
* pyschiatric condition
